sense.def:
To tie one thing to another
pomeni pritrditi eno stvar k drugi z vrvico.

seg.quote: ...one of those labels you tie onto the handle of your suitcase.

sense.def:
To tie a piece of string round something
ali
to tie something with string
pomeni položiti vrvico okoli nečesa in njena konca pritrditi skupaj.

seg.quote: ...a little dog which had a ribbon tied round its neck.

sense.def:
To tie one's shoelaces
pomeni povezati konca vezalke v pentljo.

seg.quote: He was still tying his laces.

sense.def:
A tie
je dolg ozek kos blaga, ki ga moški nosijo pod ovratnikom srajce in spredaj zavežejo v vozel.

seg.quote: He took off his jacket and loosened his tie.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
is tied to something else
, je v tesni zvezi z nečim drugim.

seg.quote: The course I chose wasn't tied to a particular academic discipline.

sense.def:
Ties
so povezave, ki obstajajo med nekom in drugimi osebami ali kraji.

seg.quote: Family ties are often very strong.
They want to loosen their ties with Britain.

sense.def:
To tie with someone in a competition or a game
pomeni v tekmovanju doseči enako število točk ali enak uspeh kot nekdo drug.

cit.quote: igrati neodločeno, deliti mesto ali nagrado

seg.quote: Two actresses tied for the Best Actress award.
In the event of a tie, the winner will be the contestant who took the shortest time.

sense.def:
To tie something up
pomeni pritrditi vrvico okoli nečesa, tako da tisti predmet ne razpade.

seg.quote: Clarissa came in, carrying some canvases tied up in brown paper.

sense.def:
To tie up an animal
pomeni pričvrstiti vrv, na kateri je žival, k trdnemu predmetu, tako da žival na more pobegniti.

To tie up one's shoelaces
pomeni vezalko na čevlju povezati v pentljo.

To tie someone up
pomeni okoli nekoga zavezati vrv, tako da ne more pobegniti.

To be tied up with something
pomeni biti v tesni zvezi z nečim drugim.

seg.quote: It's all tied up with the attempt to build a new spire for the cathedral.
